p: Variations of α- and β-pinene percentages in essential oils of annual needles of all studied Picea abies trees are presented in Table S2. The results of correlation analysis showed a strong positive correlation between percentages of pinene isomers (r = 0.69, p < 0.05), implying that the syntheses of α- and β- isomers of pinene are quite closely linked to each other in Picea abies. Additionally, statistically significant positive correlations were established between percentages of pinene isomers and essential oils in Picea abies needles with α-pinene correlating to essential oil stronger (r = 0.62, p < 0.05) than β-pinene (r = 0.33, p < 0.05).
